reviewText:
First let me get this out of the way: I've played this for probably an hour, despite what steam's weird gametime tracking thing says. I've played it on a few different computers which is probably why it says I've played it for such a short time.

Secondly: This is probably the second worst game I've gotten on Steam, the worst obviously being Air Control.

In Desert Gunner, you're a guy manning a turret. In the desert. That's literally it. The multifacited levels" the game description promises is really just one level where your convoy drives slowly in a straight line and you shoot at things.

Unlike some of the great turret shooters out there (Beachhead 2002
recommended: in this one you'll have NO clue weather or not you're actually hitting anything. You fire and fire and fire and no visible damage or anything happens. Then your'e dead. Start the level over again. But when you start the level over again you won't be able to tell because the whole level is a straight line.\n\nYou can switch between guns with the WASD keys
hoursPlayed: not that the game tells you that. Also
voteText: when you start the game up
helpfulPercent: the three green dots that are offscreen on the main menu are actually "options"
votesTotal: and "exit" respectively. You simply won't be able to read them because the game
votesFunny: on all three computers I've tested it on
commentsCount: the game insists on running on a non-native
column16: non supported resolution.\n\nI've tried it on a 4:3 monitor where it started in 16:9
column17: and a 16:9 where it started in 4:3. No idea why that is
column18: but worth noting: You won't be able to read half the main menu items.\n\nIf you're a gun-nut such as myself
column19: you might be interested in reading the technical specs the game has on all the weaponry you'll be using. You'll be significantly less interested when you find out that most of them are downright incorrect
column20: and all of them are wirtten in text with font so small that you can't read them.\n\nAll in all
column21: don't waste your dollar. It's not even fun to laugh at like Air Control
column22: it's just a mess. The developer put three seconds of effort into this
column23: so you should treat them similarly."
column27: 34 of 35 people (97%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
You ever though about playing a real bad game?But didnt know which you should try out to see how bad gaming can be?
Then you found one of the most unplayable games ever.Congratulation!!!Go and buy Desert Gunner instantly!GO and buy it,
you will.......ENJOY it.
Let me explain its FEATURES"

FEATURE 1!!!!
Without any Reason you cant change sometimes the Resolution.
A basic feature not working.

FeATurE 2!<111!!
If you Change the Audio Driver....the Sound is gone
GONE FOREVER!!!....ok....until you "REINSTALL" it...

FEATURE 3
Ohh one of its best "FEATURES" the aiming is amazing
the game has no mouse Options and use a kind of "autoaim"
that is more disturbing then helping while playing.
If you try too imagine it....then STOP you CANT
date:
you never seen something
similar

F-E-A-T-U-R-E-4
The levels are evry time the same....its like A WORLDGENERATOR with
3 or 4 assets repeating nearly the same....

FE>>AT>>URE>>5
YOU CAN USE YOUR ARROW KEYS TO SWITCH THROUGH VEHICELS
AAAAAAND!LEFT/RIGHT ARROW SWITCH THROUGH GUNNER POSITIONS...........
ok there is just the Abrahms with a "switchable" gunner position but who cares

ffeeaattuurree 6
ENEMY AI.....<---DID I SAY AI?Hmm its not a "AI" like many games offer
its more like running in front of a Abrahms and firing the AK....very Effective

OK its time to STOP with those "features" cause the game is how it is.
And the Feature list would be to long to explain all the Features you see in
the first 10 minutes of playing.Because after 10 Minutes you think about getting
a Refund for this Piece of......"

reviewText: A interesting work of Avante-Garde, Desert gunner is a shovelware title mostly taking place in what I can earnestly say is the Middle East. It's graphics are ghastly and its gameplay repetitive. What I find interesting is its unbelievably hard difficulty. Boasting 20 levels, yet I can not surpass the first one. For any collector of the shovelware kind, it is definitely a piece worth getting.

reviewText:
One of the best games of all time.

Buy a copy, put it on your media centre, and watch it. It's so fun to watch.

Eventually, due to all the memory leaks, the game will crash! But just how long will it take?

That's up to your CPU and RAM to decide!

FUN FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY

reviewText: I'll say it quickly. It is buggy, bad sounds (rockets sound like fireworks, machine guns sound like peas being dropped on a plate), graphics are good compared to other aspects, animations and models are just horrible. The second rail-FPS" i played this year. The first one was Rambo: The Video Game. I think that Deser Gunner > Rambo. So thumbs up for that."

reviewText: I didn;t have any of the problems these people did. The game worked fine. It's not amazing, true, but it's not horrifyingly bad either. It's form 2006 after all, some things just don't age well.

reviewText: I am very stunned with the quality of this game. The game was officially released Dec 31 2006, but the game is one of the best you could probably find. It takes skill, patience, and the capability to enjoy yourself. The game is amazing, and out of 5, I'd honestly rate this game a 6. It is top of the line, without a doubt.\n\nI truly recommend everyone to buy the game, seeing as the price is amazing too!

reviewText: Fear, sadness, regret-these are the emotions I felt when I played this simulation of real life desert combat. This is a masterpiece, a steal at $5.\n\nj/k I won this in a Steam Auction to get the badge.

reviewText:
Even as a fan of turret levels, this was just a drab, boring and tediously difficult game to endure. My itch to beat every game I start has damned me once again.

The AI is atrocious even for their simple, menial existence. The graphics are laughable. The levels are the same boring stretch of highway for 20 missions and the machineguns sound worse then cap-guns and half-inflated whoopie-cushions.

I bought this for 50 cents, and I should have saved it for the vending machine in my workplace breakroom. I can't believe the chaps who made Beachhead crapped out this pre-alpha of a Finished" product."

reviewText: terrible.  if someone told me this game was created as a first-year CS homework assignment, I would believe them.  think flash game.  you might find it fun for 5 minutes and then you'll get bored and uninstall it never to let it clutter your hdd again.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Do not purchase this game. That simple. I could likely get a Windows 98 PC and a game for it cheaper than this is AND it be better quality than this. This game is one of the poorest I've had the misfortune to play, how they plan to sell it at $4.99 is outrageous! They clearly need to move a decimal over to $.49 but it still isn't worth that or the 84 MB it stores on your computer. Definitely not worth it for a game that has the most choppy graphics I've seen on Steeam, poor controls, etc. Many regard ET for the 2600 as the worst game but this sure comes close.

reviewText: No worth the money, you could find better flash games online for free.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I bought this on sale and for around a dollar its not a bad grab for some quick action. Considering it is a 2006 title the graphics are not bad and it runs smoothly. The real issue is the lack of introduction or instruction. The first mission you are immediately being attacked. I figured out that you can shoot the primary weapon with left mouse button and usually a machine gun with right mouse, also you can switch between units in your convoy with up and down. Are there any other controls? I don't know.\n\n6/10 buy for a dollar.
